channel.title: News – Standalone test spies, stubs and mocks for JavaScript. Works with any unit testing framework 2023

item.title: Erdogan elected president of Turkey for the third term
item.dc:creator: Tetreamra
item.description: Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been elected for the third consecutive term as the President of Turkey. He won the second round of the presidential election held in the country on Sunday. Turkey’s...
item.content:encoded:
Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been elected for the third consecutive term as the President of Turkey. He won the second round of the presidential election held in the country on Sunday.

Turkey’s state news agency Anadolu reported that 97 percent of the votes had been counted. Erdoğan got 52.1 percent of the votes. And the candidate of the main opposition alliance, Kemal Kilicdarolu, got 47.9 percent of the votes. Erdoğan was re-elected as the private president.

National elections were held in Turkey on May 14. At that time, no presidential candidate received 50 percent of the vote. Erdogan came closest to winning with 49.5 percent of the vote. Next was Kemal Kilicdarolu. His vote was 44.8 percent. As a result, the vote was conducted in the second round.

Erdogan has been serving as the president of Turkey since 2014. Before that, he was the country’s prime minister from 2003 to 2014. And he was the mayor of Istanbul from 1994 to 1998.
